entry.title: Combined summary - Add importprivkeys RPC
entry.summary: The discussion centers around the complexities encountered by users, particularly within the Namecoin community, when attempting to import private keys into Bitcoin Core descriptor wallets. This process is currently seen as cumbersome for average users due to the limitations inherent in the wallet's design. To address this issue, a Python tool named Core-Wallet-Migration-Tools has been developed and shared on GitHub, providing a means for users to migrate their private keys, including those of legacy and Bech32/SegWit formats, into Bitcoin Core descriptor wallets. The tool can be accessed at [Core-Wallet-Migration-Tools](https://github.com/blocktraveler/Core-Wallet-Migration-Tools). Despite the availability of this workaround, there is an acknowledged need for a more seamless, integrated solution within Bitcoin Core itself. A proposed solution to this problem is the introduction of a new RPC call, 'importprivkeys', specifically designed for descriptor wallets. This would be distinct from the 'importprivkey' call that is currently used for legacy wallets. The 'importprivkeys' call aims to allow the direct importation of Wallet Import Format (WIF) keys into descriptor wallets, thus enhancing the user experience by making it easier to manage private keys within these wallets. The technical specifics and justification for this proposal are detailed in a document available at [Proposal: Add importprivkeys RPC](https://gist.github.com/blocktraveler/3e6198c698a272bd8b13b16e0f13d390). In support of this proposal, it is suggested that the return scheme for the 'importprivkeys' command could extend the one from the existing 'importdescriptors' command, potentially simplifying implementation. Additionally, the introduction of a checksum induction flag in 'importdescriptors' is recommended to reduce dependency on the 'importprivkeys' command while also enhancing both commands. This suggestion points towards ongoing efforts to improve the Bitcoin development ecosystem, aiming to make digital asset management more accessible, secure, and efficient for users.
